attributes.action: take the strongest possible action against the Sudanese governement to underline the unacceptabily of their action in jailing Gillian Gibbons
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
We all know that Gillian Gibbons was in Sudan in an effort to help the country through education. This work has been thrown back in her face in the most unacceptable, barbaric fashion from the Sudanese government, judiciary and people.

We call on the British government to have the courage of their convictions, and take the strongest possible action which could include strong protests to the Sudan government, the removal of the Sudanese embassy from London, a trade embargo, and taking the issue to the United Nations. Other actions might also be appropriate.
